p: Zinc performs catalytic, structural and regulatory functions [ 97, 98], being important for the regulation of lipid, protein and nucleic acid metabolism, as well as gene transcription [ 98]. The molecular mechanisms of action of zinc are linked to its involvement in the structure and function of over 300 enzymes, including oxidoreductases, transferases, hydrolases, lyases, isomerases and ligases [ 97, 104]. Zinc is also a component of numerous DNA transcription factors (zinc fingers) [ 100, 105].
